level.heading: FAILURE TO ANSWER THE NOTICE OF INFRACTION (ยง 16-3105)

level.text: If a respondent fails to answer an NOI within fifteen (15) days of date of service, the Director shall issue and serve upon respondent a second NOI, in a form prescribed by the Director.
A second NOI shall include the following:
The name and address of the respondent;
An identification of the NOI to which the respondent has failed to respond in a timely manner, and the amount of the fine and penalty for such failure to respond;
Notification of the following:

That the respondent is subject to a penalty equal to the amount of the fine because of the respondent’s failure to respond to the initial NOI in a timely manner, unless the respondent shows good cause for the failure to respond to the NOI in a timely manner;

That the respondent has a right to a hearing to show good cause for the failure to respond to the NOI in a timely manner and that, if the ALJ determines that there is good cause, the respondent has a right to a hearing on the infraction;
That, if the respondent fails to pay the fine and penalty or request a hearing within fifteen (15) days of the date of service of the second NOI the following shall occur:
The penalty for failure to answer in a timely manner shall increase to twice the amount of the initial fine and the respondent’s license or permit may be suspended; and
The respondent shall be required to appear at a hearing to show cause why the respondent’s license or permit should not be suspended for such failure to make timely payment or request a hearing;
That the respondent has no right to adjudication of the infraction by mail; and
That the acceptable forms of payment are as follows:
Cash, which is not acceptable by mail; or
A personal check, company check, certified check, cashier’s check, postal money order, or bank money order payable to the order of the District of Columbia Treasurer; and
Any other information that the Director may require.
A second NOI signed by the Director shall be prima facie evidence that the respondent has not answered the initial NOI in a timely manner.
A second NOI shall be served and answered in the same manner as an initial NOI, with the following exceptions:
If a respondent admits the infraction, the respondent is required to include payment of the penalty, in addition to the fine, with the answer;
Respondent has no right to adjudication of the infraction by mail; and

Respondent has no right to a hearing on the infraction unless the respondent shows good cause for the failure to timely answer the initial NOI. To show good cause, a respondent shall request a hearing in the manner provided by ยง3103 within fifteen (15) days of the date the second NOI is served. Upon a showing of good cause, an ALJ may either proceed to consider the infraction or require the respondent to request another hearing on the infraction.
A respondent who fails to answer a second NOI within fifteen (15) days of service:
Shall have no right to a hearing on the infraction unless the respondent establishes good cause for the failure to answer; and
Shall be required to appear at a hearing to show cause why the respondent’s license or permit should not be suspended for such failure to answer.
